ARABIC: فَضْلًا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَنِعْمَةً وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: It is a great favour from Allah and a blessing. Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: By God's benevolence and His grace. God is all-knowing and all-wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: by Allah's favour and bounty. Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: as a favor and a blessing from God. God is All-knowing and All-wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The munificence and favour of Allah; and Allah is All Knowing, Wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: This is a grace from Allah and His favor. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: By grace from Allah and as a favor; and Allah is Knowing, Wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: by God's favour and blessing; God is All-knowing, All-wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (It is) a bounty and a grace from Allah; and Allah is Knower, Wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: through God's bounty and favour; God is all knowing, and wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Through grace from Allah and His favour; and Allah is Knowing, Wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: a grace and blessing from Allah, and Allah is all-knowing, all-wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: A Grace and Favour from Allah; and Allah is full of Knowledge and Wisdom.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: (This is) a Grace from Allah and His Favour. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: by the Favor and Blessing of Allah. Allah is the Knower and the Wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: A Grace and Favor from God. God is Knowing and Wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [It is] as bounty from Allah and favor. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [49:8] [that is] a favour from God (fadlan is a verbal noun, in the accusative because of the implied verbal action, that is, afdala, ‘He gives a favour’) and a grace, from Him, and God is Knower, of them, Wise, in His bestowal of graces on them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (It is) a bounty and a grace from Allah) that He honoured the believers; (and Allah is Knower) of honouring the believers, (Wise) in placing in their hearts love of faith and hatred of disbelief, lewdness and rebellion.
